title: 110_s2386
content: The Act titled "Mortgage and Rental Disaster Relief Act of 2007" provides disaster relief measures. Section 408(c) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to include provisions for temporary mortgage and rental payments for individuals or households facing financial hardship due to a major disaster. Adjusted gross income and financial hardship definitions are specified in the amendment. The amendment to Section 408(c) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act provides for temporary mortgage and rental payments for individuals or households affected by a major disaster. Eligibility includes those who are employed by or own a business in the disaster area and have lost income due to a business relationship with a local business. The amendment to Section 408(c) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act allows the President to provide temporary mortgage or rental assistance to individuals and households financially impacted by a major disaster. Eligibility criteria include those who have suffered financial hardship due to travel restrictions or closures after the disaster. The amendment to Section 408(c) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act allows the President to provide temporary mortgage or rental assistance to individuals and households financially impacted by a major disaster. Eligibility criteria include income limits of $75,000 for individuals or households, with exceptions for high-cost living areas. Assistance under this paragraph is available to individuals or households residing in high-cost living areas affected by a major disaster, with an adjusted gross income not exceeding $100,000. The President will annually adjust income limits to reflect inflation. During a financial hardship caused by a major disaster, individuals or households in high-cost living areas can receive assistance for up to 18 months. To apply, they must submit an application with required information and sign a statement confirming eligibility. If records are unavailable, alternative procedures will be followed. Individuals or households must submit necessary records within 6 months of applying for assistance. If found ineligible, they must return the full amount of assistance received. The amendment made by this Act applies to any major disaster declared on or after October 21, 2007.
